These are plants and animals that have had their DNA artificially altered in a lab, often by splicing genes from totally unrelated species. This is not natural and has never been proven safe for human consumption.

Studies have shown that GMOs can cause serious health problems in lab animals, including organ damage, infertility, and even premature death. We are already seeing skyrocketing rates of allergies, autoimmune diseases, and chronic illnesses in the human population that correlate with the introduction of GMOs into our food supply. 

Many GMO crops are engineered to produce their own pesticides or to withstand massive doses of herbicides, leading to residues in the food we eat. These chemicals have been linked to cancer, hormonal disruption, and damage to the gut microbiome. And the long-term effects are completely unknown since GMOs have only been widely consumed for a couple decades.

Over 60 countries around the world, including the entire European Union, have banned or restricted GMOs due to health and environmental concerns. But here in the U.S., the biotech industry has managed to suppress research, silence dissent, and hide the truth from the public. It's time to wake up to the dangers and demand that our food be pure and natural, not a science experiment!

The impact of GMOs on gut health is one of the most alarming aspects of this issue. Many GMO crops are engineered to either produce their own pesticides or withstand massive doses of herbicides like glyphosate (the active ingredient in Roundup). These chemicals are ending up in our food and wreaking havoc on the delicate balance of our gut microbiome.

Glyphosate in particular has been shown to be an antimicrobial, meaning it kills bacteria. But it doesn't kill bacteria indiscriminately - it tends to kill off the beneficial bacteria while leaving behind the pathogenic, disease-causing bacteria. This throws off the balance of the gut microbiome and can lead to a condition called leaky gut syndrome.

Leaky gut occurs when the tight junctions between the cells lining the intestines become loosened, allowing particles like toxins, microbes, and undigested food to leak through the intestinal wall and into the bloodstream. This triggers an immune response and chronic inflammation, which is at the root of many diseases.

Studies have shown that glyphosate disrupts the shikimate pathway, a metabolic pathway used by both microbes in the gut and plants. By interfering with this pathway, glyphosate kills beneficial gut bacteria like lactobacillus and bifidobacteria while promoting the growth of pathogenic bacteria like clostridium and salmonella.

The glyphosate also chelates (binds to) important minerals like calcium, magnesium, and zinc, making them unavailable to the body. This nutrient deficiency can contribute to the breakdown of the gut lining and exacerbate leaky gut.

This disruption of gut bacteria and leaky gut syndrome has been linked to a wide range of diseases, including celiac disease, gluten sensitivity, inflammatory bowel disease, obesity, diabetes, autism, Alzheimer's, and autoimmune diseases. And the rise in these conditions correlates closely with the introduction of glyphosate and GMOs into our food supply.

Given the serious risks to gut health and the cascade of diseases that can result, it's imperative that we avoid GMOs and the toxic chemicals they're drenched in. Our health, and the health of future generations, depends on it.
